gurmukhi: ÃÄ siqgur pRswid ]
roman: ikOankaar satigur prasaadh ||
english: The Lord is One and he can be attained through the grace of the True Guru.

gurmukhi: pwiqSwhI 10 ]
roman: paatishaahee 10 ||
english: Written by the Sovereign King, Guru Gobind Singh Ji

gurmukhi: qÍ pRswid ] sv`Xy ]
roman: tavai prasaadh || sava'ye ||
english: BY THY GRACE SWAYYAS

gurmukhi: sRwvg su`D smUh isDwn ky dyiK iPirE Gr jog jqI ky ]
roman: sraavag su'dh samooh sidhaan ke dhekh firio ghar jog jatee ke ||
english: I have seen during my tours pure Sravaks (Jaina and Buddhist monks), group of adepts and abodes of ascetics and Yogi.

gurmukhi: sUr surwrdn su`D suDwidk sMq smUh Anyk mqI ky ]
roman: soor suraaradhan su'dh sudhaadhik sa(n)t samooh anek matee ke ||
english: Valiant heroes, demons killing gods, gods drinking nectar and assemblies of saints of various sects.

gurmukhi: swry hI dys ko dyiK rihE mq koaU n dyKIAq pRwnpqI ky ]
roman: saare hee dhes ko dhekh rahio mat kouoo na dhekheeat praanapatee ke ||
english: I have seen the disciplines of the religious systems of all the countries, but seen none of the Lord, the Master of my life.

gurmukhi: sRI Bgvwn kI Bwie ikRpw hU qy eyk rqI ibnu eyk rqI ky ]1]21]
roman: sree bhagavaan kee bhai kirapaa hoo te ek ratee bin ek ratee ke ||1||21||
english: They are worth nothing without an iota of the Grace of the Lord. 1.21.

gurmukhi: mwqy mqMg jry jr sMg AnUp auqMg surMg svwry ]
roman: maate mata(n)g jare jar sa(n)g anoop uta(n)g sura(n)g savaare ||
english: With intoxicated elephants, studded with gold, incomparable and huge, painted in bright colours.

gurmukhi: kot qurMg kurMg sy kUdq paun ky gaun ko jwq invwry ]
roman: koT tura(n)g kura(n)g se koodhat paun ke gaun ko jaat nivaare ||
english: With millions of horses galloping like deer, moving faster than the wind.

gurmukhi: BwrI Bujwn ky BUp BlI ibiD inAwvq sIs n jwq ibcwry ]
roman: bhaaree bhujaan ke bhoop bhalee bidh niaavat sees na jaat bichaare ||
english: With many kings indescribable, having long arms (of heavy allied forces), bowing their heads in fine array.

gurmukhi: eyqy Bey qu khw Bey BUpiq AMq ko nWgy hI pWie pDwry ]2]22]
roman: ete bhe ta kahaa bhe bhoopat a(n)t ko naa(n)ge hee paa(n)i padhaare ||2||22||
english: What matters if such mighty emperors were there, because they had to leave the world with bare feet.2.22.

gurmukhi: jIq iPrY sB dys idswn ko bwjq Fol imRdMg ngwry ]
roman: jeet firai sabh dhes dhisaan ko baajat ddol miradha(n)g nagaare ||
english: With the beat of drums and trumpets if the emperor conquers all the countries.

gurmukhi: guMjq gUV gjwn ky suMdr ihMsq hYN hXrwj hjwry ]
roman: gu(n)jat gooR gajaan ke su(n)dhar hi(n)sat hai(n) hayaraaj hajaare ||
english: Along with many beautiful roaring elephants and thousands of neighing houses of best breed.

gurmukhi: BUq Biv`K Bvwn ky BUpq kaunu gnY nhIN jwq ibcwry ]
roman: bhoot bhavi'kh bhavaan ke bhoopat kaun ganai nahee(n) jaat bichaare ||
english: Such like emperors of the past, present and future cannot be counted and ascertained.

gurmukhi: sRI piq sRI Bgvwn Bjy ibnu AMq kau AMq ky Dwm isDwry ]3]23]
roman: sree pat sree bhagavaan bhaje bin a(n)t kau a(n)t ke dhaam sidhaare ||3||23||
english: But without remembering the Name of the Lord, they ultimately leave for their final abode. 3.23.

gurmukhi: qIrQ nwn dieAw dm dwn su sMjm nym Anyk ibsyKY ]
roman: teerath naan dhiaa dham dhaan su sa(n)jam nem anek bisekhai ||
english: Taking bath at holy places, exercising mercy, controlling passions, performing acts of charity, practicing austerity and many special rituals.

gurmukhi: byd purwn kqyb kurwn jmIn jmwn sbwn ky pyKY ]
roman: bedh puraan kateb kuraan jameen jamaan sabaan ke pekhai ||
english: Studying of Vedas, Puranas and holy Quran and scanning all this world and the next world.

gurmukhi: paun Ahwr jqI jq Dwr sbY su ibcwr hjwr k dyKY ]
roman: paun ahaar jatee jat dhaar sabai su bichaar hajaar k dhekhai ||
english: Subsisting only on air, practicing continence and meeting thousands of persons of all good thoughts.

gurmukhi: sRI Bgvwn Bjy ibnu BUpiq eyk rqI ibnu eyk n lyKY ]4]24]
roman: sree bhagavaan bhaje bin bhoopat ek ratee bin ek na lekhai ||4||24||
english: But O King! Without the remembrance of the Name of the Lord, all this is of no account, being without an iota of the Grace of the Lord. 4.24.

gurmukhi: s`uD ispwh durMq dubwh su swj snwh durjwn dlYNgy ]
roman: sa'udh sipaeh dhura(n)t dhubaeh su saaj sanaeh dhurajaan dhalai(n)ge ||
english: The trained soldiers, mightly and invincible, clad in coat of mail, who would be able to crush the enemies.

gurmukhi: BwrI gumwn Bry mn mYN kr prbq pMK hly n hlYNgy ]
roman: bhaaree gumaan bhare man mai(n) kar parabat pa(n)kh hale na halai(n)ge ||
english: With great ego in their mind that they would not be vanquished even if the mountains move with wings.

gurmukhi: qoir ArIn mroir mvwsn mwqy mqMgn mwn mlYNgy ]
roman: tor areen maror mavaasan maate mata(n)gan maan malai(n)ge ||
english: They would destroy the enemies, twist the rebels and smash the pride of intoxicated elephants.

gurmukhi: sRI piq sRI Bgvwn ikRpw ibnu iqAwig jhwn indwn clYNgy ]5]25]
roman: sree pat sree bhagavaan kirapaa bin tiaag jahaan nidhaan chalai(n)ge ||5||25||
english: But without the Grace of the Lord-God, they would ultimately leave the world. 5.25.

gurmukhi: bIr Apwr bfy birAwr Aibcwrih swr kI Dwr BC`Xw ]
roman: beer apaar badde bariaar abichaareh saar kee dhaar bhachha'yaa ||
english: Innumerable brave and mighty heroes, fearlessly facing the edge of the sword.

gurmukhi: qorq dys milMd mvwsn mwqy gjwn ky mwn ml`Xw ]
roman: torat dhes mali(n)dh mavaasan maate gajaan ke maan mala'yaa ||
english: Conquering the countries, subjugating the rebels and crushing the pride of the intoxicated elephants.

gurmukhi: gwVHy gVHwn ko qoVnhwr su bwqn hIN ck cwr lv`Xw ]
roman: gaaRhe gaRhaan ko toRanahaar su baatan hee(n) chak chaar lava'yaa ||
english: Capturing the strong forts and conquering all sides with mere threats.

gurmukhi: swihbu sRI sB ko isrnwiek jwck Anyk su eyk idv`Xw ]6]26]
roman: saahib sree sabh ko siranaik jaachak anek su ek dhiva'yaa ||6||26||
english: The Lord God is the Cammander of all and is the only Donor, the beggars are many. 6.26.

gurmukhi: dwnv dyv PinMd inswcr BUq BivK Bvwn jpYNgy ]
roman: dhaanav dhev fani(n)dh nisaachar bhoot bhavikh bhavaan japai(n)ge ||
english: Demons, gods, huge serpents, ghosts, past, present and future would repeat His Name.

gurmukhi: jIv ijqy jl mY Ql mY pl hI pl mY sB Qwp QpYNgy ]
roman: jeev jite jal mai thal mai pal hee pal mai sabh thaap thapai(n)ge ||
english: All the creatures in the sea and on land would increase and the heaps of sins would be destroyed.

gurmukhi: puMn pRqwpn bwF jYq Dun pwpn ky bhu puMj KpYNgy ]
roman: pu(n)n prataapan baadd jait dhun paapan ke bahu pu(n)j khapai(n)ge ||
english: The praises of the glories of virtues would increase and the heaps of sins would be destroyed

gurmukhi: swD smUh pRsMn iPrYN jg sqR sBY Aivlok cpYNgy ]7]27]
roman: saadh samooh prasa(n)n firai(n) jag satr sabhai avilok chapai(n)ge ||7||27||
english: All the saints would wander in the world with bliss and the enemies would be annoyed on seeing them.7.27.

gurmukhi: mwnv ieMdR gijMdR nrwDp jOn iqRlok ko rwj krYNgy ]
roman: maanav i(n)dhr gaji(n)dhr naraadhap jauan tiralok ko raaj karai(n)ge ||
english: King of men and elephants, emperors who would rule over the three worlds.

gurmukhi: koit iesnwn gjwidk dwn Anyk suAMbr swj brYNgy ]
roman: koT isanaan gajaadhik dhaan anek sua(n)bar saaj barai(n)ge ||
english: Who would perform millions of ablutions, give elephants and other animals in charity and arrange many svayyamuaras (self-marriage functions) for weddings.

gurmukhi: bRhm mhysr ibsn scIpiq AMq Psy jm Pws prYNgy ]
roman: braham mahesar bisan sacheepat a(n)t fase jam faas parai(n)ge ||
english: Brahma, Shiva, Vishnu and Consort of Sachi (Indra) would ultimately fall in the noose of death.

gurmukhi: jy nr sRI piq ky pRs hYN pg qy nr Pyr n dyh DrYNgy ]8]28]
roman: je nar sree pat ke pras hai(n) pag te nar fer na dheh dharai(n)ge ||8||28||
english: But those who fall at the feet of Lord-God, they would not appear again in physical form. 8.28.

gurmukhi: khw BXo jo doaU locn mUMd kY bYiT rihE bk iDAwn lgwieE ]
roman: kahaa bhayo jo dhouoo lochan moo(n)dh kai baiTh rahio bak dhiaan lagaio ||
english: Of what use it is if one sits and meditates like a crane with his eyes closed.

gurmukhi: nHwq iPirE lIey swq smudRin lok gXo prlok gvwieE ]
roman: nhaat firio le'ee saat samudhran lok gayo paralok gavaio ||
english: If he takes bath at holy places upto the seventh sea, he loses this world and also the next world.

gurmukhi: bws kIE ibiKAwn soN bYT kY AYsy hI AYsy su bYs ibqwieE ]
roman: baas keeo bikhiaan so(n) baiTh kai aaise hee aaise su bais bitaio ||
english: He spends his life in such performing evil actions and wastes his life in such pursuits.

gurmukhi: swcu khoN sun lyhu sBY ijn pRym kIE iqn hI pRBu pwieE ]9]29]
roman: saach kaho(n) sun leh sabhai jin prem keeo tin hee prabh paio ||9||29||
english: I speak Truth, all should turn their ears towards it: he, who is absorbed in True Love, he would realize the Lord. 9.29.

gurmukhi: kwhU lY pwhn pUj DrXo isr kwhU lY ilMgu gry ltkwieE ]
roman: kaahoo lai paahan pooj dharayo sir kaahoo lai li(n)g gare laTakaio ||
english: Someone worshipped stone and placed it on his head. Someone hung the phallus (lingam) from his neck.

gurmukhi: kwhU liKE hir AvwcI idsw mih kwhU pCwh ko sIsu invwieE ]
roman: kaahoo lakhio har avaachee dhisaa meh kaahoo pachhaeh ko sees nivaio ||
english: Someone visualized God in the South and someone bowed his head towards the West.

gurmukhi: koaU buqwn ko pUjq hY psu koaU imRqwn ko pUjn DwieE ]
roman: kouoo butaan ko poojat hai pas kouoo mritaan ko poojan dhaio ||
english: Some fool worships the idols and someone goes to worship the dead.

gurmukhi: kUr ikRAw auriJE sB hI jg sRI Bgvwn ko Bydu n pwieE ]10]30]
roman: koor kriaa urajhio sabh hee jag sree bhagavaan ko bhedh na paio ||10||30||
english: The whole world is entangled in false rituals and has not known the secret of Lord-God 10.30.
